docs.title: 📊 Quant Analysis Playground
docs.text:
Welcome to the home of my research notebooks, experiments, and projects in quantitative finance, forecasting, and sports analytics.

Explore the sections below:

  • 📁 Notebooks
  • 📚 Guides
  • 🛠 Projects
  • ℹ️ About

docs.title: ℹ️ About
docs.text:
This site hosts a curated set of models, notebooks, and tools developed by Ryan Williams.

My goal is to blend reproducible research, practical finance, and interactive analysis using tools like Julia, Python, Pluto, Jupyter, and more.

Feel free to connect on LinkedIn or visit my homepage.

docs.title: 📚 Guides
docs.text:
The following writeups complement the notebooks and include background, methodology, and key insights.

  • How to Evaluate Forecasting Models
  • Intro to Feature Engineering in Sports Data
  • Portfolio Simulation with Monte Carlo Methods

docs.title: 📁 Notebooks
docs.text:
Browse the currently available notebooks:

  • notebooks/k_forecast.jl – Forecasting pitcher strikeout percentage (K%)
  • notebooks/volatility_modeling.ipynb – Volatility surface and GARCH estimation (planned)

All notebooks are designed for reproducibility and teaching.

docs.title: ⚾ MLB Strikeout Forecasting
docs.text: File: notebooks/k_forecast.jl Modeling pitcher strikeout percentages using ridge regression and random forests.

docs.title: 📈 Financial Modeling Toolkit (Coming Soon)
docs.text: Reusable components for return prediction, portfolio analysis, and simulations.

docs.title: 📊 Data Utilities
docs.text: Tools for transforming raw sports or market data into model-ready formats.
